programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
When a 44-to truck rolls over and blocks a busy dual carriageway in Derby, operations manager Steve needs all his know-how to tackle the job. Plus, a van leaves the road and lands in Lock Eck, sinking 20 metres to the bottom, and a bus that has broken down on a busy road needs rescuing
S05E04

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Jim leads a raid on a suspected drug dealer, Dan and Gordy respond to reports of an attack in an alleyway, and Jon goes on the hunt for a serial drug driver. Elsewhere, the interceptors combine forces when they fear that a gun-toting brawler may be on the loose
S12E05

programme.title: The Angry Hills (1959)
programme.desc: An American reporter in Nazi-occupied Greece is given a list of the names of resistance leaders. He is asked to smuggle it out of the country and take it to British intelligence, which leads to his being pursued across the country by the Gestapo and their collaborators. Second World War thriller based on the novel by Leon Uris, starring Robert Mitchum and Stanley Baker

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: The Angry Hills (1959)

programme.title: The Last Hunt (1956)
programme.desc: Cruel and bloodthirsty buffalo hunter Charlie Gilson comes into conflict with his world-weary companion Sandy. The tension between them comes to a head when Gilson kills a group of Native Americans and takes one of the women captive, prompting Sandy to step in and protect her. Western, starring Robert Taylor, Stewart Granger and Debra Paget

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
Ant and Matt arrive at the scene of a catastrophic lorry crash on a narrow road. A truck is wedged three metres deep in a boggy dyke after coming a cropper in the freezing fog
S05E05

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
Twenty-five miles north of York, Julian is called to the scene of a crash in which a car careered off the road and hit a tree, with the driver pronounced dead at the scene. Elsewhere, officers disturb two suspects they believe have been carrying out break-ins leading to a 100mph chase across a golf course
S06E12

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Jenno joins the takedown of a man suspected to be armed, while Dan and Gordy hit the door of a suspected drug den. Meanwhile, Ian arrests a driver who is so drunk that he cannot even put his shoes on the right feet, and Steve rushes to help a pregnant woman caught in a three-car collision
S12E08

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Jim and the team take to the road to spring a trap on suspected drug dealers, while Dan and Gordy track down a man seen roaming the streets armed with two knives. John picks up the pieces of a multi-car pile-up, and an early morning raid sees officers break down doors in search of class-A drugs
S12E09

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PC Andy Doran pulls over a driver for using his mobile phone behind the wheel and the situation escalates when the driver continues to avoid Andy's questions. On the M53, PC Chris Swash pulls over a car that is being driven at over 90mph and detects a strong smell of cannabis, so performs a drug test, while PC Amy Hollis is called to the scene of a two-vehicle collision near Cheshire Oaks
S02E08

programme.title: Trucking Heavy
programme.desc:
At a limestone quarry in Yorkshire, hauliers are tasked with moving a pair of stone crushers, each weighing over 70-tonnes. In Southampton, a boat haulier team prepare a survey vessel
S02E03

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Cameras capture wildfires as they ravage California, a tornado terrorising people trapped in a petrol station and daredevils skydiving over Antarctica

programme.title: Outback Truckers

programme.title: In Old California (1942)
programme.desc: A Boston pharmacist joins the California gold rush and pitches up in Sacramento, where the crooked brothers who run the town take an instant dislike to him - and frame him by poisoning his medical supplies. Rejected by the community, he makes plans to leave - but when the town is hit by an epidemic, he resolves to stay on and save those who once turned on him. Western, starring John Wayne, Binnie Barnes, and Albert Dekker

programme.title: Colt .45 (1950)
programme.desc: A gun salesman pursues the outlaws who stole a consignment of his weapons, in the hope of proving he did not provide them willingly. The quest leads to him becoming a deputy lawman after he protects a stagecoach - but does not realise the sheriff is in league with the bandits he is hunting. Western, starring Randolph Scott and Ruth Roman

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
An elderly woman near York has collapsed in her bathroom, jamming the door shut. Near the Yorkshire Dales, an elderly man driving without his glasses is responsible for a hit and run. And in Filey, North Yorkshire, a people-carrier has collided with a mobility scooter. Jamie Theakston presents
S06E13

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Dan and Gordy engage in the high-speed pursuit of a dangerous disqualified driver, while the big blue van is called in when a late-night scuffle spirals out of control, Jim's intuition is proven right after a routine stop reveals a secret stash, and the hunt is on for a wanted man in a bobble hat
S12E11

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Sean uses a manual battering ram on a raid on a drug dealer's house, while Jim's pursuit of a speeding driver leads to some narcotic-related discoveries and there is a high-speed chase through the streets of Macclesfield. Jenno gets a faceful of pepper spray, Jim has to deal with a mouthy drink driver, and Tom hunts down a violent armed robber
S12E12

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
Near Scarborough, there's a force-wide hunt for a group of dangerous and violent thieves on the run. As officers give chase to two stolen vehicles, their lives are put at risk as their cars are rammed and damaged by the thieves desperate to get away. In York, as the pubs and clubs kick out, a routine stop of riders on electric scooters suspected of drink driving leads to confrontation and difficult arrests
S12E16

programme.title: Police: Suspect No 1
programme.desc:
A devastating rampage of distressing and targeted burglaries is terrorising the elderly and vulnerable around a single town. The MO is the same every time and the police are called out almost daily to yet another ransacked address, but the perpetrator evades them. Detectives quickly suspect that the break-ins might be the work of one man who is known to them, so Inspector Tom Smith and his CID team need to find and apprehend him fast - and that's not going to be easy
S02E02

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Drugs Bust: Ortis Deley follows officers from Cleveland and Durham's specialist unit as they embark on a series of operations targeting crimes connected to narcotics. From chasing down people driving under the influence of drugs to raiding cannabis factories, Sgt Kevin Salter and his crew take on the drug game's key players in the north-east of England. Showcasing all the action of one eventful night, Ortis is in the thick of it as the interceptors ultimately seize more than £500,000 of contraband

programme.title: Piano Greats at the BBC
programme.desc: A collection of songs from the kings and queens of the keyboards, whose performances have captivated audiences over the decades across a selection of the BBC's best-loved music programmes. From piano pioneers like Little Richard, Nina Simone and Ray Charles, who showed the world that the new sounds of pop and rock didn't just revolve around guitars, right through to modern maestros like Elton John, Lady Gaga and Jools Holland

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc:
Advice for anyone considering dentistry abroad from specialist dentist Dr Rhona Eskander. Plus, an investigation into the pros and cons of medical technology
S01E04

programme.title: Paramedics on Scene
programme.desc: Episode 3 (Shortened): In Paisley, crew members Gary and Peter rush to treat a patient whose heart rate is dangerously fast. They are able to stabilise him by using an old trick - bumping him down the stairs in a wheelchair, which stimulates his vagus nerve and slows his heart rate - before transporting him to hospital. In Melrose, Lee and Nadine attend a 40-year-old woman with severe Covid symptoms. She is struggling to walk, and the crew gives her oxygen in the ambulance on the way to hospital.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the progress of a terrace in Worksop, a studio apartment in Bath and a house with several flats in Liverpool
S26E16

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Brackley 7: Charlie Ross and experts Thomas Forrester and Stephanie Connell go antique hunting in Brackley, Northamptonshire, before heading to Stratford-upon-Avon for the latest auction. Charlie is also going all to pot as he discovers the canal communities favourite type of earthenware
S59E19

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc:

S24E50

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc:
A woman living in a one-bedroom flat in London needs more space, so the team turns her tired and unloved courtyard into an extra living area with some clever storage solutions
S01E07

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
North Yorkshire: A huge kitchen is a big priority for Steve Brown's couple as they take in the sights and sounds of the North Yorkshire countryside. Away from property search, Steve meets a group of men in a shed to learn about a scheme that helps their mental and physical health
S22E10

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc:
Nigel Havers presents as members of the public invite the dealers to bid on their items - a model plane, a ride-on funfair whale, a draughtsman's kit, a set of stilts and a transforming table ideal for picnics
S04E23

programme.desc:

S03E14

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc:
Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Rose Matafeo

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Conservative Party

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Ronan Keating present the magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Jack and Denise worry for Amy as she blames herself for their problems. Zack comes clean about the reason he can't take part in the boxing match and tells Sharon and Martin he has HIV

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The contestants face two challenges designed to gauge both their creativity and culinary repertoire. The first is set to a brief by leading food critic Jay Rayner, who asks that they put their finest dishes forward using a batter or dough. After that, they are challenged to serve up a dish featuring chocolate
S19E05

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
It's all about innovation as Gordon invites the food and drink entrepreneurs to Oxford to replicate a sushi platter as demonstrated by a master of the craft. Who will listen and learn? He then asks them to embrace the world of cocktails and seltzers in a can, challenging them to come up with a brand that stands out on supermarket shelves. They launch their products at the world-famous Royal Henley Regatta, where undercover experts report back to Gordon on which ones are proving the most popular
S02E04

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce chairs the topical debate from York, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing questions from the audience

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: BBC journalists including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason host a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc:
The Unseen Bits - 2: Material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 16 episodes. Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Motsi Mabuse, Bez, Sarah Greene, Joe Wilkinson, Snoochie Shy, Lucy Martin, Anton Du Beke, Jo Brand, Steve Pemberton, Shazia Mirza, Lucy Beaumont, Tom Allen, Amol Rajan, Bob Mortimer, Professor Alice Roberts and Morgana Robinson
S16E11

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc:

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc:
A campaign to warn of birth defects in babies whose mothers take the epilepsy drug sodium valproate while pregnant. Plus, fake medicines being touted as 'cures' for autism
S01E05

programme.title: Paramedics on Scene
programme.desc: Episode 4 (Shortened): In Edinburgh, crew members Kevin and Martyn treat a man suffering from blinding headaches, and in Dunfermline Jason and Billy attend a 94-year-old who has fallen at home and cannot get back up. In Paisley, Peter and Kirsty attend a minor road traffic collision. Although the driver seems fine, the crew explain why they like to keep patients like this in the ambulance for 20 minutes or so, just in case there is a delayed reaction to the accident. In Ayr, a man has walked into a plate glass window, and although he seems fine, Elaine and Arin are concerned about the bump to his head

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
Martin Roberts and the team explore properties about to be auctioned online in Stoke-on-Trent, Chestfield in Kent and west London. They are later bought by developers who hope to make money on their investments - two projects are destined for the rental market, while the third is about building new houses and selling them on
S25E55

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Abernyte 30: Natasha Raskin Sharp is in her home city of Glasgow, where she visits the world-famous Burrell Collection - 9,000 rare antiques and artworks that were donated to the city in 1944. Meanwhile, Danny Sebastian and Roo Irvine help the teams
S64E31

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc:
Sparks fly when Marlene meets an outspoken farmer who hates the police, who has accused a rival of sabotaging her milking equipment. Not only does he have an alibi, but he responds with a counter accusation of dumping toxic waste. Meanwhile, a stressed-out Finn is pushed to breaking point
S02E06

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc:
A team of cleaners and DIY experts has just one day to help a household reclaim their space and fall back in love with their home. Here, the squad visits south Wales, coming to the rescue of a busy entrepreneur who has no time to 'fix! her house. They must organise her messy living room into a space that the whole family can use and where she can run her business effectively, while also cleaning and organising months of clutter and grime. Presented by Asher Edwards, Maxine Dwyer and Tommy Walsh
S01E01

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
Norfolk: Jonnie Irwin is in Norfolk to help a couple with an £800,000 budget buy their first property together, and rides on a narrow gauge steam train when he meets the enthusiasts keeping the Bure Valley Railway running
S19E34

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc:
The dealers bid on a wooden toy bus, a unicycle, a hand-made model of a mill, a Norwegian pan from the 1970s and a ladder believed to have been used in a French library in the early 20th century. Presented by Nigel Havers
S04E24

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc:

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc:
The Best Bits: A compilation of the best bits from series 15, hosted by Rob Brydon. David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests including Bob Mortimer, Alan Titchmarsh, Sarah Millican, Holly Willoughby, Jim Broadbent and Gyles Brandreth
S15E11

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The remaining hopefuls serve up the two courses they hope will see them through to knockout week. John Torode and Gregg Wallace taste their efforts, as well as three previous champions - -Thomasina Miers (2005), Kenny Tutt (2018) and Saliha Mahmood-Ahmed (2017). With just two places up for grabs, the amateurs need to show real flair and ambition to edge closer to this year's trophy
S19E06

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc:
David Tennant hosts the current affairs quiz, with writer and broadcaster Richard Osman and comedian Lucy Beaumont joining Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's headlines
S65E02

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc:
The Statue: Wicky is called to a quiet town where someone has thrown a bucket of blood over a statue at the middle of a protest. Unfortunately, as he sets about cleaning it up, it becomes clear that the row is far from over and he finds himself embroiled in a debate that looks like it might turn nasty. Zoe Wanamaker, Susannah Fielding and Louis Emerick guest star
S02E05

programme.title: Blinded by the Light (2019)
programme.desc: Javed Khan is a British-Pakistani college student living in 1980s Bedfordshire under a domineering father. Facing parental pressure and everyday racism, he unexpectedly finds his frustrations and ambitions expressed in Bruce Springsteen songs. Inspired by the rock star and a teacher who encourages his own writing, he sets out to fulfill his dreams. Coming-of-age drama, starring Viveik Kalra, Kulvinder Ghir and Meera Ganatra

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: Our Changing Planet
programme.desc:
The second of two programmes exploring efforts to rebalance vulnerable habitats around the world. Gordon Buchanan returns to Brazil to revisit a pioneering project that's committed to saving the jaguar. Ella Al-Shamahi is in Cambodia to investigate the impact the country's growing economic success is having on natural resources. Ade Adepitan visits Kenya to investigate how people and elephants are fighting over dwindling food and water supplies

programme.desc:

They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades and the team welcome Helle and David into the Repair Shop who bring with them a diamond and sapphire engagement ring that has passed down through three generations of David's family. Having been lost for over a year, the couple were lucky to find it on a gravel driveway only to find it was twisted beyond belief and two of the gems had fallen out. They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Finally, Paul Flynn is hoping Suzie Fletcher can restore his leather bait wallet from his summers spent fly fishing with his Uncle Bob in Ireland as a child
S06E13

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
For the sixth leg of the race, the pairs must brush up on their language skills as the next stop is at the heart of French-speaking Canada, the capital of its largest province, Quebec. To get there, the teams must navigate through Canada's most densely inhabited region. For the first time in the race, transport and accommodation choices will be plentiful - but potentially damaging for dwindling budgets
S03E06

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades and the team welcome Helle and David into the Repair Shop who bring with them a diamond and sapphire engagement ring that has passed down through three generations of David's family. Having been lost for over a year, the couple were lucky to find it on a gravel driveway only to find it was twisted beyond belief and two of the gems had fallen out. They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Finally, Paul Flynn is hoping Suzie Fletcher can restore his leather bait wallet from his summers spent fly fishing with his Uncle Bob in Ireland as a child
S06E13

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:

To get there, the teams must navigate through Canada's most densely inhabited region. For the first time in the race, transport and accommodation choices will be plentiful - but potentially damaging for dwindling budgets
S03E06

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of the start of the 43rd staging of the 26.2-mile race, as approximately 50,000 competitors take to the streets of the capital. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Baroness Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

Gordon Buchanan returns to Brazil to revisit a pioneering project that's committed to saving the jaguar. programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.desc:

Having been lost for over a year, the couple were lucky to find it on a gravel driveway only to find it was twisted beyond belief and two of the gems had fallen out. They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Finally, Paul Flynn is hoping Suzie Fletcher can restore his leather bait wallet from his summers spent fly fishing with his Uncle Bob in Ireland as a child

For the first time in the race, transport and accommodation choices will be plentiful - but potentially damaging for dwindling budgets

In Paisley, Peter and Kirsty attend a minor road traffic collision. Although the driver seems fine, the crew explain why they like to keep patients like this in the ambulance for 20 minutes or so, just in case there is a delayed reaction to the accident. In Ayr, a man has walked into a plate glass window, and although he seems fine, Elaine and Arin are concerned about the bump to his head

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades and the team welcome Helle and David into the Repair Shop who bring with them a diamond and sapphire engagement ring that has passed down through three generations of David's family. Having been lost for over a year, the couple were lucky to find it on a gravel driveway only to find it was twisted beyond belief and two of the gems had fallen out. They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Finally, Paul Flynn is hoping Suzie Fletcher can restore his leather bait wallet from his summers spent fly fishing with his Uncle Bob in Ireland as a child
S06E13

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
For the sixth leg of the race, the pairs must brush up on their language skills as the next stop is at the heart of French-speaking Canada, the capital of its largest province, Quebec. To get there, the teams must navigate through Canada's most densely inhabited region. For the first time in the race, transport and accommodation choices will be plentiful - but potentially damaging for dwindling budgets
S03E06

programme.title: Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark (2019)
programme.desc: The shadow of the Bellows family has loomed large in the small town of Mill Valley for generations, and young Sarah Bellows turns her tortured life and horrible secrets into a series of scary stories. These terrifying tales soon have a way of becoming all too real for a group of unsuspecting teens, who stumble upon Sarah's spooky home. Horror, starring Zoe Margaret Colletti and Michael Garza

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Leicester City v Wolverhampton Wanderers and Liverpool v Nottingham Forest. Leicester and Wolves are among a number of teams battling to avoid relegation, while Forest are also in danger, but did prevail 1-0 when they met Liverpool at the City Ground in October. Plus, Fulham v Leeds United, Brentford v Aston Villa and Crystal Palace v Everton

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of the start of the 43rd staging of the 26.2-mile race, as approximately 50,000 competitors take to the streets of the capital. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Baroness Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: Our Changing Planet
programme.desc:
The second of two programmes exploring efforts to rebalance vulnerable habitats around the world. Gordon Buchanan returns to Brazil to revisit a pioneering project that's committed to saving the jaguar. Ella Al-Shamahi is in Cambodia to investigate the impact the country's growing economic success is having on natural resources. Ade Adepitan visits Kenya to investigate how people and elephants are fighting over dwindling food and water supplies

Plus, Lee Young challenges Fiona to place a trio of model cars in order of value

Frustrated by Estella's reluctance to marry Drummle, Miss Havisham foists another unsuspected suitor on her daughter, who is driven to desperate lengths to seize control of her life

programme.desc:
Jay Blades and the team welcome Helle and David into the Repair Shop who bring with them a diamond and sapphire engagement ring that has passed down through three generations of David's family. They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Finally, Paul Flynn is hoping Suzie Fletcher can restore his leather bait wallet from his summers spent fly fishing with his Uncle Bob in Ireland as a child

Next, they create bottled sauces to sell at Hawkr Market in Gateshead, Tyne and Wear. It's a crowded market, so will anyone impress the secret industry greats Gordon has invited to the venue - and will anyone convince Sauce Shop enough to launch their brand as a 'special edition'?

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades and the team welcome Helle and David into the Repair Shop who bring with them a diamond and sapphire engagement ring that has passed down through three generations of David's family. Having been lost for over a year, the couple were lucky to find it on a gravel driveway only to find it was twisted beyond belief and two of the gems had fallen out. They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Finally, Paul Flynn is hoping Suzie Fletcher can restore his leather bait wallet from his summers spent fly fishing with his Uncle Bob in Ireland as a child

For the first time in the race, transport and accommodation choices will be plentiful - but potentially damaging for dwindling budgets

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades and the team welcome Helle and David into the Repair Shop who bring with them a diamond and sapphire engagement ring that has passed down through three generations of David's family. Having been lost for over a year, the couple were lucky to find it on a gravel driveway only to find it was twisted beyond belief and two of the gems had fallen out. They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Finally, Paul Flynn is hoping Suzie Fletcher can restore his leather bait wallet from his summers spent fly fishing with his Uncle Bob in Ireland as a child
S06E13

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
For the sixth leg of the race, the pairs must brush up on their language skills as the next stop is at the heart of French-speaking Canada, the capital of its largest province, Quebec. To get there, the teams must navigate through Canada's most densely inhabited region. For the first time in the race, transport and accommodation choices will be plentiful - but potentially damaging for dwindling budgets
S03E06

programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. programme.desc:

They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Our Changing Planet
programme.desc:
The second of two programmes exploring efforts to rebalance vulnerable habitats around the world. Gordon Buchanan returns to Brazil to revisit a pioneering project that's committed to saving the jaguar. Ella Al-Shamahi is in Cambodia to investigate the impact the country's growing economic success is having on natural resources. Ade Adepitan visits Kenya to investigate how people and elephants are fighting over dwindling food and water supplies
S02E02

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

Plus, Lee Young challenges Fiona to place a trio of model cars in order of value

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

Ella Al-Shamahi is in Cambodia to investigate the impact the country's growing economic success is having on natural resources. Ade Adepitan visits Kenya to investigate how people and elephants are fighting over dwindling food and water supplies

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
Jay Blades and the team welcome Helle and David into the Repair Shop who bring with them a diamond and sapphire engagement ring that has passed down through three generations of David's family. Having been lost for over a year, the couple were lucky to find it on a gravel driveway only to find it was twisted beyond belief and two of the gems had fallen out. They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Finally, Paul Flynn is hoping Suzie Fletcher can restore his leather bait wallet from his summers spent fly fishing with his Uncle Bob in Ireland as a child

For the first time in the race, transport and accommodation choices will be plentiful - but potentially damaging for dwindling budgets

programme.title: London Marathon
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the prestigious 26.2-mile event, including the conclusions of the men's and women's elite races. This is the first time the marathon has taken place in its traditional spring slot since 2019, when it was switched to autumn due to the Covid-19 pandemic. British icon Mo Farah is set to take on reigning champion Amos Kipruto in the men's race, while a star-studded women's field includes world record holder Brigid Kosgei, Olympic gold medallist Peres Jepchirchir and 2022 winner Yalemzerf Yehualaw. With commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Tanni Grey-Thompson and Paula Radcliffe, and reports from Jeanette Kwakye, JJ Chalmers, Steve Brown and Sarah Mulkerrins

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home
S03E05

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the second semi-final, held at Wembley Stadium. Brighton are looking to reach the final for only the second time, with their only other appearances in the showpiece match coming in 1983, when they lost to today's opponents after a replay. United last lifted the trophy in 2016 and have already tasted victory once here this season, when they defeated Newcastle United 2-0 in the Carabao Cup final. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Glenn Murray, and commentary by Steve Wilson and Danny Murphy

A one-bedroom flat in Hackney, central London, a semi in Stoke-on-Trent and a cottage with huge potential in a village just outside Bath are sold at online property auctions. Once renovated, the developers who bought them all hope to turn a profit on their investments. Presented by Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Jacqui Joseph
S26E18

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:

Before heading off to the auction, presenter Eric Knowles pays a visit to the Milestones Museum in Basingstoke, where they use the exhibits to offer reminiscence therapy to people with memory problems
S54E09

S02E10

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:

S19E08

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
In the Lake District, Gordon tasks the contenders to collect pine needles and cones from 40-foot trees to infuse into Michelin-starred Mille Feuille in a bid to demonstrate how they can turn humble ingredients into profit. Next, they create bottled sauces to sell at Hawkr Market in Gateshead, Tyne and Wear. It's a crowded market, so will anyone impress the secret industry greats Gordon has invited to the venue - and will anyone convince Sauce Shop enough to launch their brand as a 'special edition'?
S02E05

programme.title: Piano Greats at the BBC
programme.desc: A collection of songs from the kings and queens of the keyboards, whose performances have captivated audiences over the decades across a selection of the BBC's best-loved music programmes. From piano pioneers like Little Richard, Nina Simone and Ray Charles, who showed the world that the new sounds of pop and rock didn't just revolve around guitars, right through to modern maestros like Elton John, Lady Gaga and Jools Holland
