programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day six at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Shaun Murphy v Si Jiahui in round one, and the start of the second-round contest between Mark Allen and Stuart Bingham. Murphy was a champion in 2005 and has been a runner-up on three occasions since, most recently when he was defeated by Mark Selby two years ago, but he lost to Stephen Maguire in the first round in 2022

programme.title: School for Scoundrels (1960)
programme.desc: A timid company owner is pushed around by his employees, deceived by a car salesman, humiliated by a waiter and finally loses his girlfriend to a dastardly rival. Salvation comes in the form of an unusual college dedicated to teaching students how to succeed through being manipulative and devious, and he sets about getting even with his enemies. Comedy, starring Ian Carmichael, Terry-Thomas, Alastair Sim and Janette Scott

programme.title: The Titfield Thunderbolt (1953)
programme.desc: Villagers try to save their railway branch from closure by taking it over as a public business - but the owners of the local bus company try to sabotage their plans, forcing them to resort to more underhand methods. Ealing comedy, starring Stanley Holloway, George Relph, John Gregson, Godfrey Tearle and Sid James

programme.title: Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema
programme.desc:
Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema: British Comedy: The critic returns to examines more of the techniques and conventions behind classic movie genres, beginning by looking at the tropes of British comedies. Mark argues that they win laughs by tapping into the public's abiding national preoccupations, from rooting for the underdog to the subversion of class and manners, as well as the audience's fascination with comedy and crime, and pastiches and parodies that take the big beasts of Hollywood down a peg or two
S03E01

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc:
Horizon: 10 Things You Need to Know About the Future: Mathematician Hannah Fry is joined by a selection of BBC science experts to investigate the British public's questions about the future, trying to discover whether people could live for ever and if there will be a cure for cancer. Hannah examines the future of transport and if it will be possible to ditch fossil fuels, looks at what the weather will be like and discovers if the planet is on the verge of another mass extinction
S2017E09

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc:
Restoration work on the miller's cottage continues, but across the lane building works at the mill grind to halt as the planning authorities investigate local objections to Griff Rhys Jones's plans. Meanwhile, the comedian makes plans for a music festival
S02E03

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc:
Colours of Earth: Helen Czerski examines the complexities of colour, including what it is, how it works, and how it has written the story of the planet. In the first edition, she looks for the colours that have made the earth multi-coloured, investigating the essence of sunlight, how vivid blue is formed from sulphur atoms, and why the presence of red ochre is a key sign of life. She also looks at why gold should not even exist on the surface of the planet, and the role of salt and water in shaping planet earth
S01E01

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day seven at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring two second-round contests - Jak Jones v Neil Robertson and Luca Brecel v Mark Williams. Robertson made a maximum 147 break in round two last year, the fifth of his career and the 12th time a 147 had been achieved at the Crucible, but would still go on to lose the match 13-11 to Jack Lisowski

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 21/07/1994: An edition of the classic pop chart programme, originally broadcast on 21 July 1994, presented by Julian Clary and featuring Warren G. & Nate Dogg, the BC52's and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 28/07/1994: An edition of the classic pop chart programme, originally broadcast on 28 July 1994, presented by Bruno Brookes, and featuring Let Loose, Erasure and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 22/04/1982: Peter Powell presents the April 22 edition, featuring music by Pigbag, Bananarama and Fun Boy Three, Elton John, Kim Wilde, Haircut 100 and Shakin' Stevens

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 20/04/1989: Nicky Campbell and Sybil Ruscoe host the edition first shown on April 20, featuring performances by Transvision Vamp, Inner City, Holly Johnson, Metallica, Midnight Oil, the Cure, Simple Minds, the Bangles and the Beatmasters with Merlin

programme.title: When Albums Ruled the World
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the heyday of LPs from the mid-1960s to the late 1970s, as bands and singers embraced the creative opportunities they offered for music and artwork. The programme also examines how the arrival of new formats heralded the end of the album's golden era. With contributions from Queen's Roger Taylor, Noel Gallagher, Mike Oldfield, the Doors' Ray Manzarek, Slash and Grace Slick of Jefferson Airplane

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc:
Archive performances from BBC music shows of the 1970s, including Top of the Pops and The Old Grey Whistle Test, featuring Alice Cooper, New York Dolls, Peter Green, Queen, Robin Trower, John Martyn, Whitesnake, Joan Jett and Black Sabbath
S01E05

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 21/07/1994: An edition of the classic pop chart programme, originally broadcast on 21 July 1994, presented by Julian Clary and featuring Warren G. & Nate Dogg, the BC52's and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 28/07/1994: An edition of the classic pop chart programme, originally broadcast on 28 July 1994, presented by Bruno Brookes, and featuring Let Loose, Erasure and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: When Albums Ruled the World
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the heyday of LPs from the mid-1960s to the late 1970s, as bands and singers embraced the creative opportunities they offered for music and artwork. The programme also examines how the arrival of new formats heralded the end of the album's golden era. With contributions from Queen's Roger Taylor, Noel Gallagher, Mike Oldfield, the Doors' Ray Manzarek, Slash and Grace Slick of Jefferson Airplane

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
A Line in the Sand: The actor begins his trek across the Sahara Desert. Landing in Morocco after crossing the Straits of Gibraltar, he proceeds to scale the High Atlas mountains and meets the Sahawari people, who provide welcome assistance in an inhospitable land. He also rides on the world's longest train, and plays a game of desert draughts
S01E01

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the evening session on day eight at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the start of two second-round matches. Mark Selby will be involved in one of these contests should he have come through his first-round encounter and will be looking to avoid his fate at this stage last year, when the 2021 champion relinquished his crown following a 13-10 defeat at the hands of Yan Bingtao

programme.title: Lost: Those Who Kill
programme.desc:
Louise's attempts to make a fresh start are frustrated when she meets Frederik again. He involves her in a new case in which a disabled woman has been found dead. In Danish
S01E05

programme.title: Lost: Those Who Kill
programme.desc:
Louise and Frederik discover a connection between Björn and Alberte, who both grew up in the Breidablik commune. Louise goes undercover and soon spots its charismatic leader, Jon. In Danish
S01E06

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc:
Escape from the Stalag Luft 112B: British PoW Major Errol Phipps is determined to escape his German captors, but his constant attempts begin to exasperate his fellow prisoners. Eventually, they all manage to evacuate the camp, leaving him behind and believing the conflict is not yet over. Second World War comedy, starring Michael Palin and Roy Kinnear
S01E03

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc:
Murder at Moorstones Manor: Members of the Chiddingfold family gather at their spooky ancestral home, leading to a series of deaths as one by one the eccentric residents are murdered and the house descends into inevitable chaos. Comedy, starring Michael Palin and Isabel Dean. First broadcast October 11, 1977
S01E04

programme.title: British Sitcom: 60 Years of Laughing at Ourselves
programme.desc: A journey through the history of the British TV sitcom, from Hancock's Half Hour in the 1950s to present day shows, revealing the inspiration behind some of the most enduring characters and how comedy has reflected changing attitudes in society. Narrated by Rebecca Front, and featuring contributions from writers and actors including Steve Coogan, Richard Curtis, James Corden, Graham Linehan, Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais

programme.title: Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema
programme.desc:
Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema: British Comedy: The critic returns to examines more of the techniques and conventions behind classic movie genres, beginning by looking at the tropes of British comedies. Mark argues that they win laughs by tapping into the public's abiding national preoccupations, from rooting for the underdog to the subversion of class and manners, as well as the audience's fascination with comedy and crime, and pastiches and parodies that take the big beasts of Hollywood down a peg or two
S03E01

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
A Line in the Sand: The actor begins his trek across the Sahara Desert. Landing in Morocco after crossing the Straits of Gibraltar, he proceeds to scale the High Atlas mountains and meets the Sahawari people, who provide welcome assistance in an inhospitable land. He also rides on the world's longest train, and plays a game of desert draughts
S01E01

programme.title: Measuring Mass: The Last Artefact
programme.desc: A hi-tech vault just outside Paris is the home of the kilogram, a small metallic cylinder that is used as the base unit of mass - it is the item against which everything else is measured. But over time, this small hunk of metal has mysteriously eroded by the weight of an eyelash, a change that could have dire consequences. This documentary tells the story of the kilogram, and follows a group of scientists as they try to redefine the weight of the world

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: All at Sea 2: The team heads offshore to examine stories related to the sea

programme.title: The Queen's Realm
programme.desc: An aerial view of England through the seasons, accompanied by verses from poets ranging from Shakespeare to Philip Larkin. With commentary from John Betjeman, and readings from Michael Hordern, Prunella Scales, Janet Suzman and Richard Pasco. Originally broadcast in 1977

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the evening session on day nine at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, as two second-round matches continue. Kyren Wilson and John Higgins could potentially meet should they have both won their first-round encounters, and the pair experienced mixed fortunes at this stage last year, with 2020 runner-up Wilson losing to Stuart Bingham and four-time champion Higgins prevailing against Noppon Saengkham

programme.title: The Alehouse Sessions
programme.desc: Norwegian violinist Bjarte Eike and his music group Barokksolistene present a joyful celebration of 17th-century folk music, fiddle tunes, drinking songs, sea shanties and pieces by Purcell and Playford, filmed in one of London's oldest taverns, the George Inn, Southwark

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: The rural idyll of eight-year-old David Copperfield is brought to an abrupt end when his widowed mother Clara remarries. Young David takes an instant dislike to Mr Murdstone, his new stepfather, and the newcomer proves the feeling is more than mutual when he send the lad away to a boarding school run by a ruthless headmaster. Adaptation of the Dickens classic with an all-star cast, including Pauline Quirke, Maggie Smith and Ian McKellen, with a young Daniel Radcliffe starring in the title role

programme.title: The Art Mysteries with Waldemar Januszczak
programme.desc:
Cezanne's Card Players: The story behind The Card Players, one of Cezanne's most famous artworks. Waldemar Januszczak considers how this image of two old men hunched over their game of cards expresses the artist's puzzling religious beliefs, particularly his fascination for Mary Magdalene
S01E04

programme.title: Christo and Jeanne-Claude: Monumental Art
programme.desc: Documentary which charts the creation of world-renowned artist Christo's first public work of art in the UK, the Mastaba. In the summer of 2018, on the Serpentine in London's Hyde Park, Christo constructed the Mastaba from 7,506 painted oil barrels. The work was inspired by ancient Mesopotamian tombs and weighs six hundred tonnes. It is the latest work in a career spanning half a century and stretching across the world, and the programme looks back on Christo's career and a life spent making provocative works of art with his wife and partner Jeanne-Claude

programme.title: Dawn Chorus: The Sounds of Spring
programme.desc: Filmed without voiceover or music, this programme highlights the call of the birds at sunrise, as those living within Britain's habitats burst into song and reveal the natural splendour of their distinctive chorus

programme.title: The Queen's Realm
programme.desc: An aerial view of England through the seasons, accompanied by verses from poets ranging from Shakespeare to Philip Larkin. With commentary from John Betjeman, and readings from Michael Hordern, Prunella Scales, Janet Suzman and Richard Pasco. Originally broadcast in 1977

programme.title: The Art Mysteries with Waldemar Januszczak
programme.desc:
Cezanne's Card Players: The story behind The Card Players, one of Cezanne's most famous artworks. Waldemar Januszczak considers how this image of two old men hunched over their game of cards expresses the artist's puzzling religious beliefs, particularly his fascination for Mary Magdalene
S01E04

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Hanoi to Ha Long Bay: Approaching Vietnamese capital Hanoi aboard the Unification Railway, Michael passes the famous street where the locomotive passes within centimetres of the houses either side of the tracks. Checking into its famous Metropole Hotel, he discovers a bunker where guests sheltered from American bombardment during the Vietnam War. At a former Soviet factory that once supplied military uniforms to the North Vietnamese army and Viet Cong, Michael discovers a progressive new manufacturer providing sportswear to the United States Olympic team. He later views the limestone islets and turquoise waters of Ha Long Bay
S01E10

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc:
Handmade in Japan: Samurai Sword: Documentary about traditional Japanese craftspeople, beginning by following Shiro Kunimitsu and his family as they craft a katana of exceptional sharpness and durability, continuing a tradition begun by their ancestors nearly three centuries ago
S01E01

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the evening session on day 10 at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of the final two second-round matches, as the line-up for the quarter-finals is confirmed. Jack Lisowski was the final player to book his place in the last eight in 2022, edging out 2010 champion Neil Robertson 13-12, and he will be involved in this session if he won his first-round match

programme.title: Flying Scotsman from the Footplate
programme.desc: A guide to life on the footplate of the nation's favourite steam engine. Cameras are placed aboad locomotive 60103 as it travels along the Severn Valley, cutting through stunning landscapes on a journey from Bridgnorth to Kidderminster. The 'cab cameras' capture veteran driver Roger Norfolk and fireman Ryan Green in action as they talk through the mechanics and challenges of operating this national treasure. Needless to say, things sometimes get hot on the footplate and not everything goes exactly to plan

programme.title: The Flying Scotsman: A Rail Romance
programme.desc: To celebrate its 90th birthday, Barbara Flynn narrates the story of the nation's love affair with the Flying Scotsman - arguably the most famous locomotive in the world, and one that symbolises all that was great about British engineering. In 2004, public donations and grants were used to purchase the train and keep it in Britain, where the National Railway Museum has been working to restore it to its former glory. First shown in 2013

programme.title: Endgame in Ireland
programme.desc:
Guns and Government: Key players in the Good Friday Agreement relive the all-night negotiations leading up to the treaty, which saw the creation of a unique power-sharing government. However, Tony Blair's compromise on decommissioning failed to overcome local distrust, and once again, the British prime minister faced another Northern Ireland crisis. With contributions from Blair, Bertie Ahern, Bill Clinton and Mo Mowlam
S01E04

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Hanoi to Ha Long Bay: Approaching Vietnamese capital Hanoi aboard the Unification Railway, Michael passes the famous street where the locomotive passes within centimetres of the houses either side of the tracks. Checking into its famous Metropole Hotel, he discovers a bunker where guests sheltered from American bombardment during the Vietnam War. At a former Soviet factory that once supplied military uniforms to the North Vietnamese army and Viet Cong, Michael discovers a progressive new manufacturer providing sportswear to the United States Olympic team. programme.title: The Flying Scotsman: A Rail Romance

In 2004, public donations and grants were used to purchase the train and keep it in Britain, where the National Railway Museum has been working to restore it to its former glory. First shown in 2013

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Jakarta to Bogor: Michael Portillo travels through Indonesia, starting out from the capital Jakarta and travelling south to the city of Bogor, where he admires its botanical gardens
S01E11

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc:
Handmade in Japan: The Kimono: The production of the traditional garment, following the painstaking process of the silk being bound, hand-dyed, woven and finally turned into a kimono by a seamstress
S01E02

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the evening session on day 11 at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the second sessions of two quarter-finals. Three-time champion Mark Williams was among the winners at this stage last year, claiming a hard-fought 13-11 victory over Mark Selby's second-round conqueror Yan Bingtao

programme.title: The Crucible: 40 Golden Snooker Years
programme.desc: Steve Davis goes back to the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield to celebrate 40 years of the world snooker championship, talking to some of the players forever ingrained in the sport's history. The venue has become the home of snooker since the championships moved there in 1977, helping to create memorable moments and scenes of drama that live on to this day. Featuring interviews with former champions Stephen Hendry and Dennis Taylor, six-time runner-up and fans' favourite Jimmy White, and celebrity snooker addicts Richard Osman and Stephen Fry

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: The story of two women who fell in love on Christmas Eve, 1944, in the Ravensbrück concentration camp - a relationship that was kept a secret for many years

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc:
Griff Rhys Jones's project nears completion - until he learns there is trouble with the roofs of the mill and the cottage. George travels to one of the last working watermills in Wales to get ideas for the mill's interior
S02E04

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc:
Colours of Life: Early Earth was the canvas for a vast new palette, with the diversity of human skin tones telling the story of how humanity spread and ultimately conquered the planet. Dr Helen Czerski explores the true masters of colour - which are often the smallest and most elusive - travelling to the mountains of Tennessee to witness the colourful mating display of fireflies, and revealing the marine creatures that can change the hue of their skin in order to hide from the world
S01E02

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc:
Horizon: Monitor Me: Dr Kevin Fong explores the boom in apps and gadgets designed to help people monitor their health around the clock. He meets some of the pioneers of this revolution and visits a man who self-diagnosed a life-threatening disease from his own data, without going to the doctor
S50E02

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Jakarta to Bogor: Michael Portillo travels through Indonesia, starting out from the capital Jakarta and travelling south to the city of Bogor, where he admires its botanical gardens
S01E11

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc:
Handmade in Japan: The Kimono: The production of the traditional garment, following the painstaking process of the silk being bound, hand-dyed, woven and finally turned into a kimono by a seamstress
S01E02

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Jakarta to Borobudur/Kutoarjo: Michael Portillo explores the largest island of the Indonesian archipelago, travelling through rainforests and paddy fields from the capital, Jakarta, to the volcanic region at the heart of Java's Central Province. He visits Java's most dangerous volcano, Mount Merapi, learns how to make noodles, and visits the Borobudur Temple, a Buddhist shrine that lay buried under a layer of volcanic ash for centuries
S01E12

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc:
Handmade in Japan: Mingei Pottery: A look at the work of the Hamadas, one of Japan's most famous families of potters, following Tomoo as he creates and fires pots in a wood-fuelled kiln
S01E03

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the evening session on day 12 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the final frames of two quarter-finals. Four-time champion John Higgins prevailed by the narrowest of margins at this stage last year, winning 13-12 against Jack Lisowski

programme.title: Davis v Taylor: The '85 Black Ball Final
programme.desc: Colin Murray presents a look back at the final of the 1985 World Snooker Championship between Dennis Taylor and Steve Davis. The match finished after midnight, but kept an estimated 18.5 million viewers engrossed until the title was decided on the final black of the 35th frame. With contributions from Barry McGuigan, Ted Lowe, Stephen Hendry and Barry Hearn

programme.title: Amongst Women
programme.desc:
Michael is infatuated with Nell and begins to defy his father's dominance. Luke's star is rising, Sheila has met her match and Maggie heads for married life
S01E03

programme.title: Amongst Women
programme.desc:
Sheila's wedding offers a last chance for Luke and Moran to be reconciled. For Moran's daughters, however, his decline reminds them they were never able to leave him. In a bid to help, they organise a family reunion. Drama, starring Tony Doyle, Ger Ryan, Susan Lynch and Anne-Marie Duff
S01E04

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc:
The day of the festival arrives, and the showman's wagon is revealed to the locals. Plus, Griff Rhys Jones reflects on George's first job as an architectural designer as work on the cottage and the mill is finally completed
S02E05

programme.desc: Steve Davis goes back to the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield to celebrate 40 years of the world snooker championship, talking to some of the players forever ingrained in the sport's history. programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc:
The Trains That Time Forgot: Britain's Lost Railway Journeys: Andrew Martin investigates why named trains, once the pride of the railway companies that ran them, have now largely been confined to locomotive history. Embarking on a series of rail journeys around Britain, Andrew revisits the routes travelled by the Flying Scotsman, the Cornish Riviera Express and the Brighton Belle, three of Britain's most famous named trains, as he reflects on the bygone golden age of railways
S15E01

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of day 13 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the opening session of the second semi-final. There was nothing between John Higgins and Ronnie O'Sullivan at the end of last year's corresponding session, as they went into Friday's play level at 4-4, but it was O'Sullivan who would eventually prevail and go on to win the title for the seventh time in his illustrious career

programme.title: Stan & Ollie (2018)
programme.desc: Biopic of Laurel and Hardy, focusing on the events of 1953 as the comedy duo try to re-ignite their film careers by embarking on a gruelling tour of British variety halls. As they set out on their demanding schedule, with their wives back home in the US, Stan is distracted by his attempts to pin down the producer of their proposed comeback film and Ollie tries to heal a rift caused by a perceived professional betrayal. The build-up of pressure starts to tarnish their precious partnership. Steve Coogan and John C Reilly star

programme.title: The Belles of St Trinian's (1954)
programme.desc: The mischievous schoolgirls hope to get rich quick by betting on a racehorse belonging to a classmate's wealthy father. However, they first have to foil a gang of thieves planning to steal the animal and outwit an undercover policewoman sent to infiltrate the school disguised as a teacher. Comedy, starring Alastair Sim, Joyce Grenfell and George Cole

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: The rural idyll of eight-year-old David Copperfield is brought to an abrupt end when his widowed mother Clara remarries. Young David takes an instant dislike to Mr Murdstone, his new stepfather, and the newcomer proves the feeling is more than mutual when he send the lad away to a boarding school run by a ruthless headmaster. Adaptation of the Dickens classic with an all-star cast, including Pauline Quirke, Maggie Smith and Ian McKellen, with a young Daniel Radcliffe starring in the title role

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Essex 2/5: Forty-seven-year-old money broker Paul hosts the second dinner party in and around Essex, aiming to impress his guests with an evening of fine dining

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Essex 3/5: Teacher Harmy hosts the third night of the competition in and around Essex, hoping to impress her guests by serving up an authentic Punjabi feast

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Essex 4/5: Recruitment consultant Adam is the fourth to host in and around Essex, and hopes to exceed expectations with a menu of posh nosh at his dad's house
S2018E53

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Essex 5/5: The last to act as host is 24-year-old recruitment consultant Grace, who hopes to dazzle her guests with a glamorous party, Essex-style. With a menu full of home-made grub and help from her family along the way, it remains to be seen whether Grace has done enough to bag the £1,000
S2018E54

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Fuerteventura: A recently married couple seek to mark the next chapter of their lives by buying a holiday apartment together in Fuerteventura, one of Spain's Canary Islands. Jean and Stuart Knight are planning to spend several weeks there every year both on their own and also with family and friends. Ben Hillman shows the pair five options within their budget of £60,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: Gran Canaria: Newlyweds Karen and John Leonard from Essex are about to retire. With the last of the six boys they have between them about to leave home, they're looking for a new adventure and a complete change of lifestyle. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties in the sunny south of Gran Canaria for their budget of £175,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc:
A history buff tries to launch guided tours in Normandy, and on their rural retreat in Portugal, a family unveil their new eco loo
S07E28

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cardiff 1/5: in Cardiff, DJ Trishna hopes her cooking will be even better than her rapping, as she hosts a hip-hop themed night in a bid to scoop the £1000 prize. However, when Yuno shakes his booty on the dance floor, opera-loving Nick is unimpressed and flirty Michelle lets her hands do the talking

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cardiff 2/5: It's the second day of the competition in Cardiff and Nick is planning to bring some refinement and fine dining to the week's proceedings. However, fastidious Nick really has set himself a mountain to climb with a massive tasting menu

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cardiff 3/5: On the third day in Cardiff, retail manager Yuno hopes to scoop the prize by whisking his guests off to the Himalayas. As well as entertaining his guests with some traditional dancing, Yuno's also hoping to tickle their taste buds by serving up Nepalese food

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cardiff 4/5: It's day four of the competition in Cardiff and turn of self-appointed 'hostess with the mostest' Michelle. She's out to impress with a culinary trip around the world, but when she sets a fun challenge, she ends up being accused of cheating

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cardiff 5/5: On the final night of the competition in Cardiff, host Suzanne is pinning her hopes on an evening of sophistication and fine French cuisine. Suzanne's menu is inspired by her many holidays to France - in fact she's been every year for the last 17 years. However, revealing the inspiration behind her starter might be a step too far for her guests, especially after the revelations found inside her 'special' cupboard!

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2021: Costa del Sol, Spain: Childhood sweethearts Laura and Nick dream of making a permanent move to Spain with their beloved dog Poppy. They're after a property in Estepona on Spain's Costa del Sol that meets both their needs and Poppy's. Property expert Jean Johansson lines up five options for their £160,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2018: Mijas, Spain: House hunter Zane wants to permanently relocate to Mijas in Spain to be closer to his son Dean, who has already moved there with his family. Danni Menzies shows the father and son five properties within the £110,000 budget, hoping at least one will prove perfect

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc:
Revisit: Isle of Wight, 2012: In 2010, architectural designer Lincoln Miles and artist Lisa Traxler found an uninspiring 1970s bungalow on a plot on the Isle of Wight surrounded by ancient woodland. As part of their renovation project, they added a three-storey 'tower' extension and used a range of unconventional techniques and alternative materials. Two years later, Kevin McCloud returned to find out whether the couple's methods led to success
S12E09

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc:
In Bradford, West Yorkshire, Michelle is tired of the abode she shares with Andrew. The bungalow, set in rolling hills, is small and was only supposed to be a temporary home - that was a decade ago. However, Andrew loves this place. Kirstie tries to convince Michelle to stay by solving her kitchen problem and adding some feminine touches to the decor. Phil, meanwhile, has found a selection of amazing properties to buy - including a bungalow that's twice the size and a barn conversion with lots of outside space
S01E03

programme.title: In the Footsteps of Killers
programme.desc:
The Milk Carton Kids: Emilia Fox and criminologist David Wilson investigate the disappearance of 13-year-old David Spencer and 11-year-old Patrick Warren, who went missing in Birmingham on Boxing Day in 1996. To this day, no one has been charged with the double disappearance and murder of the two friends, and their bodies have never been found despite two major police investigations and a missing persons campaign that featured the boys' pictures on milk cartons. But now, Emilia and David discover new evidence leading to a prime suspect
S01E01

programme.title: Passengers (2016)
programme.desc: A spacecraft transporting thousands of people to a distant planet malfunctions. As woken travelling companions Jim Preston and Aurora Lane fall in love, they are soon on a collision course with more technical problems and a dark secret. Sci-fi drama, starring Jennifer Lawrence, Chris Pratt and Michael Sheen

programme.title: Scared of the Dark
programme.desc:
Scared of the Dark: The Final: Danny Dyer presents the final of the pitch-black contest, which sees the celebrities more reliant on each other than ever. As Chris Eubank, Paul Gascoigne, Max George, Nicola Adams, Chris McCausland, Scarlett Moffatt, Donna Preston and Chloe Burrows compete to earn some precious moments in the light, their bond is at an all-time high. But that could all change when each of them are presented with a leap-of-faith task that could impact the entire group's future in the competition
S01E05

programme.title: Celebrity Hunted
programme.desc:
Ed and James bait the hunters into a showdown at Taskmaster House while Nik and Eva taunt them with a public appearance in Leicester Square and on the Heart Radio breakfast show. Katya and Aimee head up to Carlisle to reunite with some friends and Saffron and Bobby lay low on the south coast
S05E04

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc:
How Heavy Is the Water?: Kiell Smith-Bynoe finds himself playing bingo without any shoes on, Mae Martin plays an unusual but potentially brilliant drum solo and all the comedians create boats to carry eggs, in a race involving eggs in boats. Greg Davies hands out the scores, while Alex Horne hands out the tasks, designed to test the comedians' daring, dexterity and dignity under pressure - and to also make them look a little bit silly too
S15E04

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc:
Sarah from Plymouth becomes the first ever returning picker having previously been on the show as David. Now proudly pansexual and living as a woman, Sarah can't wait to road test her new body and hopes her first date as a woman will be everything she has dreamed of. Twenty year-old plumber Jamie from Swansea is fed up with being hit on by OAPs at work, he comes into the studio looking for love
S11E01

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Edinburgh 1/5: Interior designer James hosts the first of a week of dinner parties from Edinburgh, hoping to impress guests Aisling, Bruce and Katy with a spicy Mexican menu
S2018E15

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:

Can Bruce pull the evening off with style, and will he do enough to grab the cash?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Torrevieja, Costa Blanca: Having just retired, Carlene Barnard wants to buy a holiday home on the Costa Blanca so that all of her family - two kids, six grandchildren and one great grandchild - can spend quality time together in the Spanish sunshine. Scarlette Douglas shows her and daughter Kerrie five properties for £90,000 in and around the seaside town of Torrevieja

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Costa Blanca: Michelle and Gary Cole from Birmingham have both suffered from ill health over the past few years and have decided that the rejuvenating effects of the Spanish sun are just what the doctor ordered. They're looking for a holiday home where they and their two kids can spend quality time together. Laura Hamilton shows them five properties on the Costa Blanca for their £65,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc:
In Spain, a bike tour business gets ready for 50 Belgians. A flat tyre adds to a family's woes in Portugal, while cameras encounter a couple who are swapping one new life in the sun for another

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Middlesbrough 1/5: On the first dinner date in Middlesbrough glamorous 41-year-old sales assistant Gail hosts a night full of sparkly gourmet grub and teaches her guests a lesson or two in beauty. Her guests are 52-year-old vintage shop owner Jane, 28-year-old football coach Dan, 57-year-old art enthusiast Julie and 47-year-old pub landlord Gary. Gail gets the glitter, sparklers and hair extensions out, but whether her food will get glowing reviews ramins to be seen

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Middlesbrough 2/5: Goalkeeping coach Dan hopes to thrill his guests with a James Bond evening in Middlesbrough, including 007-inspired food and a Bond villain. however, Julie and Jane fail to 'bond' on the night, falling out over everything from who's been the best James Bond, to how to pronounce Roger Moore. Gary and Gail also fall out when the table chat turns to 'lookey-likeys'. After dinner, Dan challenges his guests to put one past him in a penalty shoot-out, which ends with a surprising result

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Middlesbrough 3/5: In Middlesbrough, pub landlord Gary plans a 1980s evening, serving classic dishes with a modern twist. However, Jane and Julie are still bickering and Gary falls out with Gail over his dessert. Showman Gary flambés his steaks at the table, and tops things off with a magic display that goes down well with all of his guests - except one

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Middlesbrough 4/5: Vintage shop owner Jane serves up a retro menu and a vintage clothes competition in Middlesbrough. Jane's been on the attack at the table so far, but she's planning to be the perfect host this time. On a lively night, there's more drama between the diners, and Julie and Gail discover that Jane has created headlines in the local news

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Middlesbrough 5/5: On the last night in Middlesbrough, Julie's Indian menu gets mixed reviews, while Gail and Jane make a shoe discovery that leads to some shocking dinner table revelations. Gary finds out how much he's got on Jane's nerves throughout the week, as the contestants candidly reveal what they think of each other

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2020: Chiclana de la Frontera , Costa de la Luz: Jonnie Irwin goes house-hunting in and around the attractive Spanish town of Chiclana de la Frontera on the Costa de la Luz, with chauffeur company owner Steve and export co-ordinator Janice. They both have busy lives and can't wait to buy their own holiday home that they can escape to for relaxing getaways with their family. They have a budget of £160,000 and are looking for a three-bedroom villa with a pool near the beach

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2018: Majorca: Cornwall couple Marc and Matt fell in love with Majorca the moment they stepped onto the island six years ago and are now looking to buy their very own holiday retreat that they can escape to at a moments notice. Armed with a budget of £200,000, Ben Hillman tries to find them their dream pad in the perfect location

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc:
Maida Vale and Ormskirk: George returns to a grand Victorian villa in Ormskirk to follow the next stage of its renovation. Having previously created a luxurious master en suite, his next task is to tackle the giant kitchen and utility area. He also visits a typical Victorian mansion block in London. Although structurally sound, the flat has been virtually untouched over the years. The result is dismal and depressing with a spare room that feels like a prison cell. Can George mastermind a plan to free up this criminal waste of space?
S06E04

programme.title: The Dog Academy
programme.desc:
Cockapoo Maggie and German shepherd Cody are brought in by their owners Diane and John, who have grown tired of Maggie's diva-like ways and cannot understand why she hates her pooch companion. Meanwhile, muzzled collie Marvin has left owners Laura and Dave at their wits' end. They are concerned by his lunging and nipping and fear he'll eventually bite someone. As trainer Jo begins the delicate process of earning Marvin's trust, there's no knowing how he'll react
S01E04

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:

programme.title: Mean Girls (2004)
programme.desc: A teenager is surprised when she is befriended by the girls in the most popular clique at her new school. However, a dating mishap leads to trouble and her supposed friends start to turn on her. Urged on by other pals outside their circle, the newcomer resolves to bring down the self-appointed queen of campus - only to end up adopting some of her rival's crueller characteristics. Comedy, with Lindsay Lohan, Rachel McAdams, Tina Fey and Lacey Chabert

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc:
Revisit: Isle of Wight, 2012: In 2010, architectural designer Lincoln Miles and artist Lisa Traxler found an uninspiring 1970s bungalow on a plot on the Isle of Wight surrounded by ancient woodland. As part of their renovation project, they added a three-storey 'tower' extension and used a range of unconventional techniques and alternative materials. Two years later, Kevin McCloud returned to find out whether the couple's methods led to success

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sutton Coldfield 3/5: In the Birmingham suburb of Sutton Coldfield, publican Randy Johnson wants to prove that he can put on more than mediocre pub grub, and tries to impress his guests with a black-tie theme and some interesting culinary techniques - including cooking with bricks. He surprises Sharon when he reveals that he used to sing in musicals, while Eva accidentally spits out a pistachio nut during one of her laughing fits

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sutton Coldfield 4/5: Lettings agent Sharon Wozniak hosts the fourth party in Sutton Coldfield, Birmingham, and she hopes to impress her guests with a classic West Midlands curry - but some diners are unimpressed by her menu. However, she manages to get French foodie Laetitia Kotsiopoulos to admit her wine was a good choice, despite being made locally. Later, her fish dish does not go down well with another contestant, so she hopes her deconstructed Margarita cheesecake can improve her chances of winning the prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sutton Coldfield 5/5: Outspoken hairdresser Patrick McMurray hosts the final party in Sutton Coldfield, and prepares a scallop starter and a classic beef Wellington. His first course goes down well, but Sharon soon becomes bored with his constant showing off - and it remains to be seen whether his saucy entertainment will prove a hit with the female guests

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Almuñécar: Marian and Donald seek a two-bed, two-bathroom property with a sea view in Almuñécar on Spain's Costa Tropical. Jasmine Harman jets off to help the pair by finding five options for them to choose between

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: Costa Blanca: Jacqui Lockhart has worked hard all her life, and now that she has the savings available she wants to fulfil her lifelong dream of owning a holiday home on Spain's southern Costa Blanca. With a cash budget of £50,000 and the support of her daughter Judy, the pressure is on for Danni Menzies to help Jacqui secure her dream property

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc:
Matt Lucas and Noel Fielding are back with the charity version of the baking show, as TV presenter Emma Willis, radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo, Taskmaster co-host Alex Horne and Inbetweeners actor Blake Harrison make their way to the tent. They take on three challenges - decorated biscuits, madeleines in the technical and a showstopping choux sculpture embodying their secret talent, with Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith passing judgement
S05E01

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country
programme.desc:
Sarah and Graham turn their attention to the guest bedroom, with plans afoot to create a secret, Narnia-inspired room in the eaves, accessed through the bedroom wardrobe. The couple head to the local auction house in Wincanton, in search of the perfect pair of matching bedside tables. Sarah also wants to build a peaceful retreat in a corner of her garden. For inspiration, she takes Laurie to Taunton to see the Willow Cathedral, a unique living structure, to recreate back at home
S03E02

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc:
How Heavy Is the Water?: Kiell Smith-Bynoe finds himself playing bingo without any shoes on, Mae Martin plays an unusual but potentially brilliant drum solo and all the comedians create boats to carry eggs, in a race involving eggs in boats. Greg Davies hands out the scores, while Alex Horne hands out the tasks, designed to test the comedians' daring, dexterity and dignity under pressure - and to also make them look a little bit silly too
S15E04

programme.title: Derren Brown: Showman
programme.desc: This one-off special brings Derren Brown's record-breaking, five-star show to TV. Written by Derren Brown, Andrew O'Connor and Andy Nyman, the award-winning team behind Miracle, Svengali and Derren's BAFTA-winning Channel 4 specials, the critically acclaimed Showman is probably Derren's most personal show to date

programme.title: Celebrity Hunted
programme.desc:
The hunters use social media in a sneaky bid to trap YouTube star Saffron Barker, so in their attempt to make it all the way to extraction, she and partner Bobby Seagull bare all. Nik and Eva Speakman head to Brighton for some deep cover at the home of former Coronation Street actor Brian Capron. In County Durham, Katya Jones and Aimee Fuller plan a rendezvous with Katya's former Strictly Come Dancing partner Ed Balls
S05E05

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of emergency services. The entire process is captured, from the moment a call is taken at the control centres to the deployment of the police, ambulance teams and fire crews, following them to the front line as they deal with the unpredictable, the shocking and the sometimes disturbing

programme.title: Night Coppers
programme.desc:
On the beat with the police officers who patrol the city of Brighton after dark. PC Jack gets called to a street assault, but finding out who is the suspect and who is the victim proves difficult. PCs Matt and Amelia find a bloody-handed youth on a bus after reports of a smashed window and PC Aj chases down a suspected house burglar
S01E06

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
A rugby player is scanned for spinal damage following a collision during a match, and describes her struggles with mental health issues as she awaits the results. A teacher is knocked off his bicycle after receiving some bad news, while a man who broke two bones in his ankle after a fall is assisted by his dead wife's best friend
S24E07

programme.title: Work on the Wild Side
programme.desc: On the Eastern Cape, its rhino day for vet Emily as she needs to move three male rhinos to a new home. And at the Vervet Monkey Foundation, Josie meets new arrival, Dobby

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cumbria 3/5: Eccentric sheepdog trainer Katy Cropper hosts the third dinner party in Cumbria, where she prepares 'come a cropper' prawns al fresco, opens a bottle of Champagne with a Masai sword, and serves some potent home-made horseradish sauce. Aside from the food, a sheep-herding demonstration proves to be a hit with her guests

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Three couples host dinner parties in Brighton, serving up an evening of glitz and glamour, a fine dining menu and South Pacific-inspired food in a bid to pocket the £1,000 prize
S2020E25

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Almeria, Spain: Nurses Philip Vaux and Alec Billen from Somerset have been dreaming about owning a place in Spain for 10 years. Having inherited some money when Alec's father died, they have decided to buy a holiday home in the beautiful province of Almería in south-east Spain, so call on Laura Hamilton for advice

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2017: Lanzarote: Patrick and Corrine Duly from East Sussex first visited Lanzarote four years ago. They immediately fell in love with the island, and now that they've retired they're looking for a holiday home where they can escape to and spend more active winters in the sun. With a budget of £140,000, Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties in the south of the island

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc:
A couple await permission for their glampsite in France, a new B&B opens in Portugal and a Norfolk family leave the UK for Italy - but their journey is far from plain sailing
S07E32

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
In Cumbria, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit collector Paula, who badly needs some cash to fix her leaking roof. Henry picks a Morris Minor for restoration, while Simon turns some unwanted wood into furniture that seriously impresses independent valuer Ronnie Archer-Morgan
S05E02

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Suffolk 1/5: Children's food educator Beth Stephens hosts the first dinner party in Lowestoft, Suffolk, where she plans to impress her guests - caravan site owner Ray, beauty therapist Polly, housing officer Jonalt and ASBO officer Rachel - with locally sourced seasonal food. However, she and Rachel gang up on Ray for most of the evening

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Suffolk 2/5: Caravan park owner Ray hosts the second night in Lowestoft, where he hopes to win the £1,000 prize with a Spanish-themed evening, complete with a homemade tropical zone and an Ibiza-style club night in a barn - despite it being the middle of winter

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Suffolk 3/5: Luxury-loving beautician Polly hosts the third evening in Lowestoft, Suffolk, and is determined to prove she is more than just a pretty face. She opts for a fine-dining menu that stresses quality over quantity, and hopes her smart dress code will bring out the genteel side of her guests - but distractions soon emerge in the form of revelations about Ray once being a new romantic

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Suffolk 4/5: Albanian-born civil servant Jonalt hosts the fourth party of the competition in Lowestoft, Suffolk, and hopes his family recipes can impress his guests. He demonstrates a hidden talent that makes the diners laugh, and one contestant is left feeling the heat when Beth and Rachel unite

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Suffolk 5/5: The final dinner party in Suffolk is hosted by anti-social behaviour officer Rachel, who hopes to win over her guests with an evening of comfort food and a few tricks up her sleeve. She hates to lose, but will need to curb her comments towards the other guests and let her dishes do the talking if she wants to be in with a chance of beating joint leaders Holly and Jonalt

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Villamartin, Costa Blanca: Lee and Louise from Warwickshire are looking for a three-bedroom, two-bathroom detached villa with a private pool in Villamartin on Spain's Costa Blanca, for their budget of £212,000. Leah Charles-King shows them five impressive properties, hoping at least one will be good enough to tempt Lee and Louise to make an offer

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2018: Orihuela Costa, Spain: London couple Merwyn and Liesl Lobo are looking for a holiday home in Orihuela Costa in eastern Spain, so Danni Menzies shows them five properties for their £125,000 budget

programme.title: The Secret World of...
programme.desc:
The Secret World of Sweets: Jo Brand unwraps the nostalgic story of the world of sweets and lifts the lid on the biggest rivalries and innovations that have driven the sweet world. Jo unpacks the historic rivalry between Rowntree's and Bassett's before the cosy British sweet market gave way to a bitter battle after the arrival of Mars and Haribo, and key players from some of the industry's biggest brands reveal just how fierce the battle is to keep life sweet
S02E03

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc:
Matt Lucas and Noel Fielding are back with the charity version of the baking show, as TV presenter Emma Willis, radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo, Taskmaster co-host Alex Horne and Inbetweeners actor Blake Harrison make their way to the tent. They take on three challenges - decorated biscuits, madeleines in the technical and a showstopping choux sculpture embodying their secret talent, with Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith passing judgement
S05E01

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: One-off special following South Yorkshire Police investigating reports of bullying, from playground brawls and racism in schools, to coercive domestic abuse. Cases featured include a 14-year-old boy hospitalised by a gang in the street, a single vulnerable woman being systematically targeted by local teens in her own home, and a distraught mother watching her 27-year-old son attempting suicide after being bullied at work

programme.title: Good Boys (2019)
programme.desc: Three lads skip school and embark on an epic journey while carrying stolen drugs. They are hunted by teenage girls, and attempt to make their way home in time for a long-awaited party. Director Gene Stupnitsky's comedy, starring Jacob Tremblay, Keith L Williams and Brady Noon

programme.title: Derren Brown: Showman
programme.desc: This one-off special brings Derren Brown's record-breaking, five-star show to TV. Written by Derren Brown, Andrew O'Connor and Andy Nyman, the award-winning team behind Miracle, Svengali and Derren's BAFTA-winning Channel 4 specials, the critically acclaimed Showman is probably Derren's most personal show to date

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc:
Anna Richardson presents as 22-year-old Ukrainian refugee Mariia enters the studio. Since fleeing the war, the pansexual sex therapist has settled in the UK and is now looking for love with a far-from-average man or woman who can keep up with her in the bedroom. She is followed by 24-year-old Alannah, a content creator from Bristol, who is seeking a forever bloke who can speak the language of love and feels comfortable in his body
S11E02

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, critiquing The Outlaws, Family Fortunes, You, Celebrity Yorkshire Auction House and The Mating Game. They also offer their thoughts on ITV News of COP26 and other stories. Narrated by Craig Cash
S18E08

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
A 69-year-old man is rushed to St George's after collapsing on a tennis court, and the resus team has to work quickly to get his dangerously high heart rate under control. Other patients include a father suffering from shortness of breath and a young man who sustained a head injury playing football. Newly qualified consultant Mehrad recounts what it's like to work under pressure and the satisfaction of saving a patient's life
S24E01

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cumbria 4/5: Holly Venning hosts the fourth dinner party from Cumbria and the food marketing manager wants to show her love for her home county through her menu. She prepares Cumbrian scallops and chorizo, followed by a traditional Cumberland sausage - but her Penrith fudge pudding doesn't appeal to everybody

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Fun-loving Karen and Irena kick-off the competition in Nottingham with a menu of comfort food. On day two, Lee and Maemae cook up an Indonesian menu with a British twist. Finally, it's Clayton and Nina's turn to up the ante with an evening of French fine dining
S2020E08

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Phuket, Thailand: Amanda and Adam Cropper have been visiting Phuket in Thailand on holiday for some time and love it so much they decided to get married on the island. Now they're looking for their very own property there, initially to use as a holiday home before they move out full-time in the next few years. Jonnie Irwin guides them through the local market and shows them five properties for their £160,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Malaga: Martial arts experts Dan and Sally Ferretti from Bristol have travelled the world for competitions, but are now looking to relax. Despite never having been to southern Spain before, this adventurous couple have decided to buy their very own holiday home there, and have identified the mountains around Malaga as the perfect place. Danni Menzies is on hand to show them five great properties for their £80,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc:
A family of five begin searching for their dream home in Italy, and it's panic stations in France as the glampsite hosts prepare for their first guests
S07E33

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
In Suffolk, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien meet former agony aunt Janet, whose garden shed is crammed with goodies. With no motors to unearth, Henry makes a rare furniture discovery, while Simon finds a vintage tram bench
S05E03

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Manchester 1/5: In the Manchester area, 27-year-old full-time mum Johanna, plans an evening dedicated to takeways from Turkey to China and India. Her guests are 34-year-old lorry driver Ryan, 48-year-old housewife Fiona, 45-year-old laundrette owner Linzi and 53-year-old translator Nico, on a night that includes a sojourn into Shakespeare

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Manchester 2/5: In Manchester, lorry-driving movie buff Ryan plans a film-inspired menu including his 'Prawn Identity' starter, 'Sausage Meat the Fockers' and 'Chocolate Clockwork Orange' desert. Unfortunately the first course is more of a disaster movie for Johanna, who has to face her fear of prawns. Meanwhile, Nico puts the cat among the pigeons with his views on male chefs and Fiona takes Linzi to task over her beauty regime

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Manchester 3/5: Glamorous 'domestic delegator' Fiona aims to impress with a classy but effortless menu as she hosts the third dinner party of the week in the Manchester area. However, critical Linzi takes issue with Fiona's mother chopping her vegetables and her cousin making her honeycomb. Then, there's more trouble brewing as Nico and Johanna clash

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Manchester 4/5: Critical laundrette owner Linzi has been a hard taskmaster all week in the Manchester area, so expects to show her guests where they've been going wrong. She's not pleased when Ryan questions her choice of starter. When the guests find out what Linzi does for a job, Nico struggles to understand the concept of a laundrette. Self-proclaimed domestic delegator Fiona has to face her fears during Linzi's entertainment - an ironing competition

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Manchester 5/5: On the final night in the Manchester area, Nico plans to show the Brits how it's done in the kitchen with his Italian cooking. He's been talking up his Italian heritage all week, and Linzi's convinced he's heading for a fall. Ryan's shocked by some of Nico's locker-room tales, while baby of the group Johanna horrifies the other female contestants with her thoughts on gender politics. It remains to be seen who will pick up the £1,000 prize

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Dénia: Newlyweds Alison and Gabriel from Greater Manchester have been together for five years and are looking to buy a property together in the town of Dénia on Spain's northern Costa Blanca. Craig Rowe lines up five properties for them to consider, all within their budget of £110,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2018: Murcia: Lea and her best friend Fiona are on the hunt for a second home in the Murcia region of Southern Spain, somewhere Lea feels will also help husband Peter's arthritis symptoms. Property expert Scarlette Douglas summons on her expertise to line up five options within the £90,000 budget

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc:
Camden, 2012: Architect Henning Stummel and his partner Alice Dawson plan to convert a dilapidated joinery workshop in north London into a contemporary family home and office. They want to preserve the building's original steel frame, but to restore it they will have to take it down, which means carefully extracting it from the neighbours' walls without causing damage to their property - and that's just the start of the couple's problems. Kevin McCloud follows their progress
S12E08

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc:
Brilliant Builds: Into the Garden: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back at two shows that highlighted the need to get the balance between home and garden just right. In Bury St Edmunds, Lauren Grant believes the opportunity to build on a land she and husband Christian bought from the council will transform their confused downstairs. He, however, just wants rid of the house altogether. Meanwhile, Harrogate couple Carol and Andrew need extra space for Grandad. Can Kirstie build into their sizeable garden or will Phil find somewhere else more suitable?
S01E06

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the week's biggest and best shows
S21E09

programme.title: xXx (2002)
programme.desc: Extreme sports star Xander Cage finds himself in trouble when his daredevil exploits land him behind bars. However, he is offered an intriguing escape route, courtesy of National Security Agent Augustus Gibbons - who thinks the adrenaline junkie is the perfect man to bring down a gang of international terrorists in Prague. Action adventure, starring Vin Diesel, Samuel L Jackson, Asia Argento, Marton Csokas and Michael Roof

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc:
Old Honkfoot: Greg Davies challenges the short-term memory and musicality of contenders Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Jenny Eclair, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Mae Martin as the five intrepid comedians approach the halfway point in the series. Frankie impresses with his falsetto, while Kiell wows everyone with his spoon retrieval abilities. Plus, Mae fakes their way into assistant Alex Horne's wallet
S15E05

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc:
Anna Richardson presents as 22-year-old Ukrainian refugee Mariia enters the studio. Since fleeing the war, the pansexual sex therapist has settled in the UK and is now looking for love with a far-from-average man or woman who can keep up with her in the bedroom. She is followed by 24-year-old Alannah, a content creator from Bristol, who is seeking a forever bloke who can speak the language of love and feels comfortable in his body
S11E02

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc:
A cheesemaker meets a marketer with an endless line of jokes, and a company director and a fan of motorbikes and rockabilly share their love of the 1950s. Two gym enthusiasts seem to hit it off, but disaster strikes later in the night, while two executives with a taste for sharp suits seem like a good fit
S20E02

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc:
Jimmy Carr hosts as Roisin Conaty and Kiri Pritchard-McLean take on Jon Richardson and Rob Beckett. Comedian Hugh Davies is in Dictionary Corner. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate
S22E01

programme.title: Snitch (2013)
programme.desc: A man learns his estranged son is facing 10 years in prison for a crime he did not commit, so makes a deal with the authorities. In return for the charges being dropped, he will go undercover as an informant in a drug trafficking operation, putting his life on the line to bring the cartel down. Crime thriller, starring Dwayne Johnson and Susan Sarandon

programme.title: Walking on Sunshine (2014)
programme.desc: A woman has a whirlwind romance in Italy and decides to get married. Her sister flies out to attend the wedding, but is shocked to discover that the groom is the man she loved and lost on a previous holiday. Musical comedy featuring a soundtrack of 1980s pop songs, starring Hannah Arterton and Greg Wise

programme.title: Inheritance (2020)
programme.desc: A patriarch dies, leaving his daughter with a shocking secret inheritance that threatens to unravel and destroy the family. Thriller, starring Lily Collins

programme.title: Urge (2016)
programme.desc: A weekend getaway turns deadly when a mysterious nightclub owner introduces a group of friends to a dangerous new designer drug. Thriller, starring Pierce Brosnan

programme.title: The Nines (2007)
programme.desc: An actor's drug-fuelled misadventures leave him under house arrest in a building he believes to be haunted, a TV writer watches his sitcom collapse around him and a man is stranded in the wilderness with a mysterious woman for company. Drama following three connected stories, starring Ryan Reynolds in multiple roles. With Melissa McCarthy and Hope Davis

programme.title: Color Out of Space (2019)
programme.desc: A meteorite crashes in the backyard of Nathan Gardner's Massachusetts house, and strange occurrences develop. Director Richard Stanley's horror fantasy based on an HP Lovecraft tale, starring Nicolas Cage, Joely Richardson and Elliot Knight

programme.title: 10 Things We Should Do Before We Break Up (2020)
programme.desc: A single mother-of-two becomes pregnant following a one-night stand with a committed bachelor, but the unlikely pair try to make a go of it. Romantic drama, starring Christina Ricci and Hamish Linklater

programme.title: Need for Speed (2014)
programme.desc: A street racer is betrayed by a friend, and ends up being framed for causing a death during an illegal contest. Two years later, he is released from prison and returns to the underground racing circuit with revenge in mind. Action adventure based on the video game, starring Aaron Paul, Dominic Cooper, Imogen Poots and Michael Keaton

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc:
The Beacon: While most of the landscape is destroyed by nuclear warheads, Strand thrives in one of the few inhabitable places left. His search for survivors uncovers a stranger with an unexpected connection to his past. Post-apocalyptic horror, starring Colman Domingo

The Wolf of Wall Street: A look at The Wolf of Wall Street
S2022E03

programme.title: Larry Crowne (2011)
programme.desc: A middle-aged man loses his job, and decides to fill his empty days by returning to college. He develops a new circle of friends among the various outcasts who have enrolled, and falls for his public speaking teacher, who has become disenchanted with her job and her marriage. Comedy drama, directed by and starring Tom Hanks. With Julia Roberts and Cedric the Entertainer

programme.title: Bel Ami (2012)
programme.desc: A penniless, amoral war veteran arrives in 19th-century Paris planning to make a name for himself in high society. He succeeds in seducing a succession of wealthy women, manipulating them into aiding his advance up the social ladder. Drama based on Guy De Maupassant's novel, starring Robert Pattinson, Christina Ricci, Uma Thurman and Kristin Scott Thomas

programme.title: Chi-Raq (2015)
programme.desc: Spike Lee's dark comic drama with Nick Cannon. After a child is killed by a stray bullet, a group of women find a unique way to take on the violence in Chicago's Southside by withholding sex. Spike Lee's comedy crime drama, starring Nick Cannon

programme.title: The Spy (2019)
programme.desc: Actress and stage star Sonja Wigert is recruited by Swedish intelligence to spy on Nazi officials during the Second World War. However, the situation is complicated when Nazi officer Josef Terboven makes her spy on the Swedes. Director Jens Jonsson's drama, starring Ingrid Bolso Berdal, Rolf Lassgard and Damien Chapelle. In Norwegian, Swedish and German

programme.title: Clara's Ghost (2018)
programme.desc: Clara Reynolds is fed up with constant badgering from her self-absorbed showbiz family and finds solace in - and guidance from - the supernatural force she believes is haunting her. Comedy thriller, starring Paula Niedert Elliott and Haley Joel Osment

Comedy drama, directed by and starring Tom Hanks. With Julia Roberts and Cedric the Entertainer

programme.title: The Last Station (2009)
programme.desc: A naive young man is appointed as the private secretary to the ageing Leo Tolstoy in 1910, but finds himself in the middle of a bitter conflict. The writer has embraced strong socialist and pacifist principles and wishes to leave everything to the people - but his wife does not want to give up his legacy. Period drama, with James McAvoy, Christopher Plummer and Helen Mirren

programme.desc:

programme.title: The Last Station (2009)
programme.desc: A naive young man is appointed as the private secretary to the ageing Leo Tolstoy in 1910, but finds himself in the middle of a bitter conflict. The writer has embraced strong socialist and pacifist principles and wishes to leave everything to the people - but his wife does not want to give up his legacy. Period drama, with James McAvoy, Christopher Plummer and Helen Mirren

programme.desc: Olympic gold medallist and Christian missionary Eric Liddell returns to China to work as a teacher and gets caught up in the Japanese invasion of 1937. Biopic, starring Joseph Fiennes, Richard Sanderson and Augusta Xu-Holland

programme.title: Sunshine Cleaning (2008)
programme.desc: A single mother struggles to make ends meet and hopes to send her seven-year-old son to private school. She hits upon the idea of starting a business cleaning up crime scenes and places where dead bodies have been discovered, and recruits her directionless younger sister to help. Comedy drama, starring Amy Adams, Emily Blunt and Alan Arkin

programme.title: Surviving Summer (2009)
programme.desc: A troubled teenager who witnessed her father's suicide spends a summer living with her grandparents and working as a waitress. She falls in love with the restaurant's ambitious cook, but her grandparents do not approve of him, as he has a criminal past. Drama, starring Hilary Duff, Evan Ross, Ellen Burstyn and Michael Murphy

programme.desc: Olympic gold medallist and Christian missionary Eric Liddell returns to China to work as a teacher and gets caught up in the Japanese invasion of 1937. Biopic, starring Joseph Fiennes, Richard Sanderson and Augusta Xu-Holland

programme.title: To the Wonder (2012)
programme.desc: An American tourist in Paris falls in love with a French single mother, and hastily marries her before bringing her home with him to Oklahoma. As their passion cools, they each seek solace in relationships with others - she turns to a fellow immigrant, a priest who is losing his faith, while her husband is reunited with an old flame. Terrence Malick's drama, starring Ben Affleck, Olga Kurylenko, Rachel McAdams and Javier Bardem

programme.title: Angel Heart (1987)
programme.desc: A shady 1950s private eye is hired by a mysterious stranger to find a missing singer with a debt to pay. The detective's search for the musician leads him into dark and disturbing territory, as everybody who helps him meets a grisly fate. However, the truth is far more shocking than he ever expected. programme.desc: Actress and stage star Sonja Wigert is recruited by Swedish intelligence to spy on Nazi officials during the Second World War. programme.title: The Tourist (2010)
programme.desc: A fugitive's girlfriend is being watched by the police while travelling from Paris to Venice. She seduces an unsuspecting American tourist to make them think he is her lover with his appearance altered by plastic surgery, leaving the baffled holidaymaker pursued across Europe by the cops and rival gangsters. Romantic thriller, with Johnny Depp, Angelina Jolie and Paul Bettany
